definition: flank (the side of one's torso)/to coerce/to threaten

sentences.english: There is no threat or force involved.
sentences.chinese: 它不涉及任何威胁或者武力。

sentences.english: But there's not much risk of interlopers.
sentences.chinese: 但是并没有多少来自闯入者的竞争威胁。

sentences.english: The beholder likes to use this ray on any foe it considers a real threat.
sentences.chinese: 眼魔喜欢将此射线用于它认为真正有威胁的对手。

sentences.english: Now the "angry river" is under a dual-threat from both soil erosion and a new dam project.
sentences.chinese: 怒江正面临着水土流失和新建大坝的双重威胁。

sentences.english: The practice of YueFang ships seriously threatened the life safety of Chinese fishermen.
sentences.chinese: 越方船只的做法严重威胁了中国渔民的生命安全。
这些够不够具有威胁性？
她接到了死亡威胁的电话。

sentences.english: Two powerful storms are threatening the coastal United States.
sentences.chinese: 两场强风暴正在威胁美国海岸地区。

sentences.english: But this does not vitiate his scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 但这不会威胁到他的奖学金。

sentences.english: We will not be frightened by threats.
sentences.chinese: 威胁是不能把我们吓倒的。

sentences.english: Otherwise, the security of the strong-named assembly would be compromised.
sentences.chinese: 否则，此强式名称组件的安全性将受到威胁。

sentences.english: Underground engineering is frequently threatened by ground water irruption.
sentences.chinese: 地下工程常常面临突水灾害的威胁。

sentences.english: The United States and other nations did nothing to deserve or invite this threat.
sentences.chinese: 这个针对美国和其他国家的威胁是没来由的。

sentences.english: Organised crime continues to be the perpetual scourge of Milanese civic life.
sentences.chinese: 有预谋的犯罪仍然是对米兰市民的永远的威胁。

sentences.english: Her boss threatened to fire her.
Localised epidemics and global pandemics periodically pose a significant national and global threat.
sentences.chinese: 局部和全球的的流行病时不时的威胁着我们。

definition: to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to disturb/to cause a commotion/to harass
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
